intro: Alloplectus macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, white or pinkish flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from its host through specialized structures called haustoria, while also performing photosynthesis. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ecological role includes providing food for birds and insects, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
